items.title: Driven by new leadership, Viewrail is shaping the future of modern stairs and railing
items.summary:
- Viewrail, founded 2001 by Len Morris, is now a vertically integrated designer, fabricator and installer of modern stairs and railings across North America, led by Caleb Morris.
- It is deploying robotics, digital design tools and connected software to link engineering, production and field support, reducing lead times and variability.
- As Official Stair and Railing Partner for The New American Home 2025 and with Schafer Floors, Viewrail aims to be the leading North American supplier by 2026.

items.title: Five top trends for UK manufacturers
items.summary: - Supply-chain diversification with multi-site production (UK, Romania, Far East) to reduce logistics risk, not full reshoring; GTK UK demonstrates agility.\n- Cybersecurity investment rises after high-profile attacks, replacing legacy OT with secure, modern OT/IT.\n- AI becomes a strategic growth driver (82% say so), enabling predictive maintenance, supplier risk assessments, and real-time customer insights for earlier design and sustainability considerations.

items.title: Autonomous solutions can empower manufacturers for 2026
items.author: Andrei Danescu
items.summary:
- UK manufacturing faces a skills gap and rising costs; autonomous systems and AMRs ease bottlenecks, improve accuracy and resilience.
- Robotics become more affordable for SMEs via collaborative robots; AI-enabled systems learn, adapt and feed data to analytics for optimization.
- By 2026 robotics sit at the heart of a new industrial era, requiring skills investment and strategic vision, with DexoryView enabling real-time visibility.

items.title: A Q&A with Rosie Evans Krimme reveals that the success of transformation is determined by people, not processes
items.summary:
- Transformation success depends on people and psychological safety, not just technology, as neglecting the human experience drives high failure rates.
- Coaching is essential to build change leadership, cultivate behavioral flexibility, and translate the change into commitment, speeding adoption.
- Practical steps include mandatory leader-as-coach training, top-level vulnerability, and embedding coaching in change initiatives to co-create the 'why'.

items.title: Metalworking applications are driving advancements in conveyor technology.
items.summary: - Self-cleaning filtration-cell conveyors filter fine chips to ~80 μm (below 100 μm for some designs), reducing downtime and extending coolant life.\n- Magnet-based conveyors place magnets under the load to attract ferrous fines, improving coolant cleanliness and enabling recycling; larger chips are removed by scrapers.\n- Together they lower maintenance, reduce sludge, and support sustainable manufacturing with potential additional income from ferrous recycling; Jorgensen offers standard and customized systems.

items.title: As global demand for electric vehicles rises, myenergi is scaling its low-carbon technologies to support the shift to smarter home energy
items.summary:
- myenergi designs and manufactures a family of home energy products (EV chargers zappi and zappi GLO, eddi, libbi, harvi) with around 250 staff and global reach.
- Plans include a vehicle-to-grid charger with ISO 15118 compliance by Jan 2027 and Gridpay to monetize smart energy assets and support capacity markets.
- Strategy centers on installer collaboration, lean manufacturing, and AI-driven data tools to optimise home energy use and grid balancing amid rising EV uptake.

items.title: From the first commercially approved Lentiviral therapy to Covid-19 vaccines, OXB is proud to celebrate 30 years of excellence
items.summary:
- OXB (Oxford Biomedica) was founded in 1995 to leverage Lentiviral vectors, delivering the first in‑vivo lentiviral treatment and growing into a full CDMO.
- During COVID-19 it partnered with AstraZeneca for large‑scale vaccines, delivering 100M+ doses and expanding with Bedford MA, Lyon/Strasbourg, and the Durham NC facility.
- A data‑driven, cross‑vector platform with centers in the UK, US and FR; a people‑first culture striving to be the world’s leading viral‑vector CDMO and enable fast, safe products.

items.title: Contec Americas celebrates 50 years of powering global automation and aerospace advancements
items.summary:
- Contec Americas marks 50 years as a lifecycle solutions partner, offering design-to-support across industrial automation, IoT, AI edge and aerospace.
- Florida ITAR-compliant clean room enables on-site display customization, reducing offshore fabrication for DoD, aerospace and defense workloads.
- End-to-end capability from custom engineering and US manufacturing to global logistics and 15-year support, with bundled, globally shippable solutions.

items.title: Explore how BioMADE is securing the future of the US through bioindustrial manufacturing innovation
items.summary:
- BioMADE's pilot-scale program uses fermenters and downstream processing to separate cells and purify products, with crystallization and spray-drying options later or via partners.
- In Minnesota, it will fund sensors, continuous fermentation, and downstream methods to remove crystal products, reserving equipment and space to demo new tech.
- As a Manufacturing USA member, BioMADE seeks to close pilot/demo-scale gaps, partner with manufacturers, train a domestic workforce, and boost US bioindustrial leadership.

items.title: Evtec Automotive continues making strides in the manufacturing industry, through inclusive employment opportunities and technological innovation
items.summary:
- Inclusive employment and social impact: 43% of Coventry staff have disabilities, internships with schools/colleges, and pathways from internships to permanent roles.
- Tech and production gains: camera-based Poka-Yoke, in-house 3D scanning, SQL ERP for real-time data; Evtec Charge EV chargers launched (Q2 2025) with UK design and 2026 assembly.
- Outlook and sustainability: net-zero efforts with solar/LEDs, ongoing smart factory upgrades, and plans to expand Tier 1 UK/global partnerships with OEMs.

items.title: WireMasters is accelerating digital innovation while investing in talent and culture
items.summary:
- WireMasters is accelerating digital innovation with a global e-commerce platform, RPA/Agentic AI for unstructured data, and an engineering-driven sales model led by Michelle van Wyk; Bo Corn becomes Strategic Advisor.
- A five-year plan targets intentional hiring, skills development, and 24/7 self-service shopping to empower customers and free sales staff.
- Core values - quality, service, family, gratitude, excellence, integrity - fuel a values-led culture shift toward leadership development and scalable growth.

items.title: Could GRC’s immersion cooling solutions be the answer to the data center energy dilemma?
items.summary: - GRC immersion cooling uses coolant tanks, a CDU, and control systems to submerge servers, cutting cooling power by up to 40% and enabling more compute in the same power envelope.\n- Benefits include reduced particulates, humidity, and oxidation, longer server life, and lower carbon footprint; ecosystem includes Dell, Cisco, SuperMicro, Schneider Electric, and Shell.\n- Two futures: an acquisition by a data-center cooling player, or GRC becoming a larger, diversified liquid-cooling company with own factories and regional HQs.

items.title: Rock Tech Lithium combines upstream mining with downstream refining to ensure vital supply chain resilience
items.summary: - Integrates Georgia Lake mining with Guben and Ontario converters to form a regional, end-to-end lithium supply chain, enabling a future closed-loop and recycled battery inputs. - Guben: 24,000 t/yr LiOH with Mercedes-Benz offtake (~40%), Ontario converter up to 36,000 t/yr LiOH, and Georgia Lake targeting 100,000 t/yr spodumene concentrate. - Aligns with EU battery passport and Critical Raw Materials Act, pursuing 40% local refining by 2030, zero-waste, lifecycle carbon reductions, and strong financing support.

items.title: McCauley Trailers leverages robotics and a strong export strategy to drive success in global markets
items.summary:
- 70‑year‑old family‑owned McCauley Trailers began exporting in 2002 and now serves 25+ countries with 50–60 product ranges, exporting about 95% of output.
- Investments over £2m in robotics (six FANUC welders) and an automated forthcoming paint/blast shop enable faster production and reduced reliance on skilled labour.
- Quality, strict pre‑delivery inspections and WVTA approvals support European sales and about 70% repeat business from existing customers.

items.title: Discover how Graham Engineering’s new service subscription model ensures exceptional support for clients
items.summary:
- Diversified from blow molding into extrusion systems via American Kuhne, Welex, and Kennedy Tool & Die, spanning medical, packaging, wire/cable, and precision tubing.
- Launched a service subscription for rapid, proactive support with PO-free workflows and remote or in-plant interventions.
- Seeks a unified three-brand system while managing complexity and investing in extrusion and integration for multiple end markets.

items.title: Following a strategic merger in 2025, Righi is expanding globally with pioneering industrial automation solutions
items.summary:
- After acquiring Sei Sistemi and Viganelli Engineering, Righi launched Righi Solutions, uniting 3 firms into 360+ staff with Italian and Asian sites delivering automation, panels and energy services.
- Growth relies on internal R&D and targeted acquisitions, with AutoStore integrated to the WMS and a cold storage project enabling real-time metering and faster shipping.
- In 2026, an India branch will push internationalisation; Righi aims to be a global lifecycle partner, investing in people, diversity and sustainability.

items.title: Royston Lead combines decades of expertise with cutting-edge technology to deliver safe, sustainable lead solutions
items.summary:
- Royston Lead, a UK-based producer of engineered lead and alloys within IMI, focuses on lead plate, extrusions, anodes and healthcare.
- Recent upgrades (new presses, casters, robot welders) back Europe expansion and growth in anodes, healthcare and extrusion.
- Sustainability and safety are priorities—99% battery recycling, energy efficiency, and a recycling-loop plan with DBT support to raise the company profile.

items.title: Recently launching its new Center of Excellence, Bruderer UK is supporting the future of UK manufacturing
New machinery and landmark contracts fuel Arkoni’s mission for compliant, high-quality metalwork
8 transformations shaping the future of manufacturing
items.summary:
- Eight transformations by 2026: AI-driven smart factories, hyper-flexible automation, smarter regional supply chains, sustainability embedded in the lifecycle, AI-enabled design, and cybersecurity becoming strategic.
- 2024–26 realities: manufacturing the most-targeted sector for cyber incidents (~25% of IBM X-Force), tighter regulation, upskilling needs, and semiconductor investments reshaping regional strategy.
- Outlook: factories become intelligence-driven, adaptable systems; success hinges on aligning digital tech, resilient infrastructure, sustainability, and strong human–machine collaboration.

items.title: Manufacturing and logistics face a wave of job cuts before the end of year
Clarksville sees surge in jobs and investment from two global manufacturers
items.summary:
- T.RAD North America will invest $90.2M at the Clarksville–Montgomery County Park South, creating 928 jobs and boosting regional transport links near Fort Campbell.
- Korea Zinc plans to acquire and redesign Nyrstar Clarksville for more than $6.6B in capex (part of $7.4B) to build an integrated smelting facility with up to ~1,500 total jobs.
- Officials project ongoing manufacturing growth through 2030 with expansions by Hankook and LG Chem; infrastructure upgrades and stormwater improvements are planned.

items.title: Joby to double aircraft output with US manufacturing expansion
items.summary:
- Joby aims to double monthly output to four FAA-conforming electric aircraft by 2027, expanding U.S. production via two hubs in Marina, CA and Dayton, OH.
- Toyota's $250 million investment embeds lean manufacturing, QA and scalable assembly, standardizes parts, and expands supplier relationships to cut costs.
- Regulatory progress (FAA testing and type inspections) supports ramp-up, with plans to capture more of the air-taxi value chain as vertiport and air-traffic integration develop.

items.title: Novartis weighs major investment in Denton manufacturing plant
items.summary: - Novartis weighs a $280 million plan to convert an unused Denton site into a radioligand therapy manufacturing plant, including hazardous-material cleanup and a secure containment facility. - Local incentives exceed $3 million, including a 10-year tax abatement, construction-material rebates, and state property tax exemptions tied to job creation and cleanup. - The project aligns with a broader US expansion, potentially creating about 150 technical jobs with salaries above $124,000 and advancing time-sensitive therapies.

items.title: Energy Consultancy of the Year Awarded to Advantage Utilities
items.summary:
- Advantage Utilities was named Consultancy of the Year (Large Customers) at the 2025 TELCA Awards in the UK energy sector.
- The award recognises excellence in consultancy, innovation and client service, and highlights helping large organisations navigate rising energy costs and decarbonise via data-led energy strategies.
- Judges praised service quality, transparency and technical expertise amid market volatility; Tim Ross credited the team and client–supplier trust, with sponsor disclosures noted.

items.title: PyroGenesis enters US additive market with precision-grade Ti64 powder
items.summary:
- PyroGenesis signs a contract to supply Ti64-grade fine-cut titanium powder (20–53 µm) to a US AM company; shipment is en route and the customer is undisclosed.
- NexGen plasma atomization produces spherical, low-porosity Ti powder with high flow, no chemical additives, enabling tight particle control and reduced post-processing.
- Titanium AM expands into regulated sectors (medical implants, aerospace); demand growth and emphasis on domestically produced, resilient supply chains.

items.title: Hadrian brings AI-driven precision to defense manufacturing
items.summary:
- AI-driven autonomous production cells embedded in defense facilities enable rapid testing, deployment, and a distributed, supplier-resilient footprint.
- Factory-as-a-service with CNCs, robotics, and real-time orchestration (Opus) supports on-the-fly tolerances, speeds, and regulatory compliance.
- Growing funding and modular automation signal a national-security emphasis on resilience and scalable modernization.

items.title: Boeing and United trial tech that could reduce air congestion
items.summary:
- IPS-based digital communications tested on a United 737-8 ecoDemonstrator to replace analog voice with data exchanges between aircraft and ground systems.
- Two-week flights evaluated data transmission, synchronization, and congestion resilience to improve routing, dispatch, and fuel use.
- Benefits may include fewer delays, smoother gate coordination, safety gains, and alignment with ICAO/FAA/Eurocontrol digital-infrastructure modernization.

items.title: Trump’s ‘golden age’ promise tests reality of tariff economics
items.summary:
- Trump's 'golden age' hinges on Liberation Day tariffs aimed at onshoring, but firms face legal uncertainty and weak near-term data.
- Early signs include some investments, but a 2026 Supreme Court ruling and ongoing policy ambiguity cloud the outlook and could raise consumer prices.
- Economists say tariffs alone won't revive manufacturing; progress requires infrastructure, training, supply-chain modernization, and resolved trade tensions.
